citation.article-title: Five new Legionella species isolated from water.

p.s: Description of Legionella londiniensis sp. nov.
Legionella londiniensis (lon. din. i. en' sis. N.L. gen. n. londiniensis, coming from London)
Legionella londiniensis is a nonmotile, oxidase-negative, catalase-positive organism.
It gives positive reactions in tests for browning on agar containing tyrosine, Î²-lactamase activity, elastase production, and casein hydrolysis.

It exhibits negative reactions in tests for hippurate hydrolysis (sometimes weakly positive), peroxidase activity, browning on agar containing 3,4- or 3,5-diaminobenzoic acid, chondroitin sulfate degradation, starch hydrolysis, lipase activity, and protease activity.
The type strain is strain 1477 (= ATCC 49505), which has a G+C content of 43 mol%.
